Literature Review: The study of plastic deformation in metallic materials has been a focal point in materials science due to its critical role in determining the mechanical properties of these materials. One of the key aspects of plastic deformation is the localization of plasticity by crystallographic slip, which can significantly influence the material's strength, ductility, and fatigue resistance. Recent advancements in both experimental and numerical techniques have provided new insights into the mechanisms and mechanics of slip localization, offering promising avenues for understanding microstructural effects, accelerating alloy design, and improving mechanical property predictions.
